title: Relative speed and acceleration - dropped stone

content.description: Student <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is standing on a cart holding a small stone, while Student <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is standing on the ground, as shown. The cart is moving at a constant speed <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> with respect to the ground in the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-direction. Student <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> then releases the stone from rest with respect to the cart. Just before the stone reaches the ground, Student <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> measures the stone’s speed as <math alttext="2 v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and its acceleration as <math alttext="a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. At the same instant, Student <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> measures the stone’s speed as <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and its acceleration as <math alttext="a sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly states the relationships of <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and of <math alttext="a sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>?
